title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a new section on the supply of vaccines. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing and storing vaccines for children and adults, including those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and other vaccines designated for public health. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing and storing vaccines for adults, including those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and other designated vaccines for public health preparedness efforts. The plan will be submitted to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor within 6 months of enactment. The Secretary will submit a plan for purchasing and storing vaccines to specific Senate and House committees within 6 months of enactment. The plan will discuss the basis and prioritization of vaccine purchases. By September 30, 2008, the Secretary must fully implement the plan to maintain vaccine supply. The Secretary must fully implement the plan for purchasing and storing vaccines by September 30, 2008. Manufacturers must provide at least 1 year notice to the Secretary before discontinuing vaccine production. The notification period can be reduced with good cause certification. Any proceeds from vaccine sales go to the Secretary. The manufacturer certifies good cause for reduction under section 506C(b) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. Proceeds from vaccine sales go to the Secretary for purchasing additional vaccines. The Secretary must submit ongoing reports detailing plan progress and any impediments. The Secretary must submit reports on plan progress and impediments. The reports should include a recommendation on extending the vaccine supply beyond 6 months and discuss the reasons behind the recommendation. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012.
